comment.body: Just if it works and how easy it is to set up. Only got 1 SSD at the moment but that may change in the future.
@Talnicrom: Agree switched 3 Years ago. But I'm forgetting stuff already because my system just runs and runs and runs and runs and I'm not tinkering as much any more because it works so well.

Because everyone has a different opinion on it, here are my 5 cents :)
I'm using systemd-boot and I'm happy with it.
Means its booting correctly, now the issue is somewhere with the desktop environment.

I use syncthing an a Pi for my own sync network no Problems so far.
https://librevault.com/ is maybe an option but still in early development
Thanks a lot for all your work
Are you playing dwarf fortress? Heard it's fun but hadn't have time to get into it.

So what I won't visit and host their Websites.
Idiots are everywhere, no matter of the platform.

I am all for freedom of speech, this also includes my freedom not to say (or distribute in this case) something.
I think Zeronet is perfect as a platform to reflect this, people can say what they want and by not visiting their sites I don't distribute their ideas.
Not allowing people to say what they think will never solve a problem in the first place, because the problem is not the speech but lack of understanding for each other.
